alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Early (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 03 at 8:37AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CST /1030 AM EST/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama, including the following county, Henry and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, Calhoun, Clay and Early. * WHEN...Until 930 AM CST /1030 AM EST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 735 AM CST /835 AM EST/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Morgan, Blakely, Headland, Edison, Newville, Bellville, Bluffton, Haleburg, Kolomoki Mounds Sp, Ferrell Crossroads, Colomokee, Harrisons Mill, Zetto, Hayes, Early Co A/p, Barnes, Shorterville and Suttons Corner. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
